element.name: abducent nerve
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne170.htm ABDUCENT NERVE]; sixth cranial nerve, VI
element.origin: a NUCLEUS in the pons, beneath the floor of the fourth ventricle, emerging from the brain stem anteriorly between the pons and medulla oblongata

element.name: accessory nerve
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne198.htm ACCESSORY NERVE]; eleventh cranial nerve, XI

element.name: accessory nerve, internal
element.origin: by cranial ROOTS from the side of the medulla oblongata, from the ambiguus nucleus
element.distribution: the internal branch to the vagus and thereby to the palate, pharynx, larynx, and thoracic viscera, pharyngeal and superior laryngeal branches of the vagus, muscles of the pharynx, larynx, and soft palate

element.name: accessory nerve, external
element.origin: by spinal roots from the side of the spinal cord (from the upper three or more cervical segments), from the nucleus of accessory nerve
element.distribution: the external branch branches to the sternocleidomastoid and trapezius muscles (shoulder)

element.name: facial nerve, motor root
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne171.htm FACIAL NERVE]; seventh cranial nerve, VII
element.origin: inferior border of pons, between olive and inferior cerebellar peduncle
element.distribution: various structures of face, head, and neck
element.modality: motor, parasympathetic, general sensory, special sensory

element.name: auricular nerve, posterior
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne177.htm POSTERIOR AURICULAR NERVE]; facial nerve, occipital branch, facial nerve proper
element.distribution: posterior auricular and occipitofrontal muscles and skin of external acoustic meatus

element.name: auricular nerve, posterior, auricular branch
element.distribution: supplies the auricularis posterior and the intrinsic muscles on the cranial surface of the auricula, in some mammals these muscles can adjust the direction of the pinna (outer ear); CN X sensory from ear skin

element.name: auricular nerve, posterior, occipital branch
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne242.htm OCCIPITAL BRANCH OF POSTERIOR AURICULAR NERVE]
element.distribution: supplies the occipitalis muscles to move the scalp

element.name: facial nerve, muscles of facial expression
facial nerve, marginal mandibular branch
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne181.htm MARGINAL MANDIBULAR BRANCHES OF FACIAL NERVE]

element.name: hypoglossal nerve
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne278.htm HYPOGLOSSAL NERVE]; twelfth cranial nerve, XII
element.origin: several ROOTLETS in the anterolateral sulcus between the olive and the pyramid of the medulla oblongata; it passes through the hypoglossal canal to the tongue
element.distribution: styloglossus, hyoglossus, and genioglossus muscles and intrinsic muscles of the tongue

element.name: communicating branches between the lingual nerve and hypoglossal nerve
element.distribution: forming a plexus on the hypoglossus muscle

element.name: oculomotor nerve
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne126.htm OCULOMOTOR NERVE]; third cranial nerve, III
element.origin: BRAIN STEM, emerging medial to cerebral peduncles and running forward in the cavernous sinus
element.distribution: entering the orbit through the superior orbital fissure, the branches supply the levator muscle of upper eyelid, all extrinsic eye muscles except the lateral rectus and superior oblique, and carry parasympathetic fibers for the ciliary muscle and sphincter pupillae

element.name: oculomotor nerve, superior branch
element.distribution: supplies superior rectus and levator palpebrae superioris

element.name: ciliary nerves, short, parasympathetic fibers
element.distribution: smooth muscle and tunics of eye

element.name: trochlear nerve
element.synonyms: MA:[http://www.oluwoleogunranti.com/course/course1/nerves/ne127.htm TROCHLEAR NERVE]; fourth cranial nerve, IV
element.origin: the fibers of each trochlear nerve (one on either side) decussate across the median plane and emerge from the back of the BRAIN STEM below the corresponding inferior colliculus
element.distribution: runs forward in lateral wall of cavernous sinus, traverses the superior orbital fissure, and supplies superior oblique muscle of eyeball
